physical_examinations.relevant_findings: 12-year-old girl with Pallisterâ€“Hall syndrome, refractory symptomatic epilepsy, mental retardation, behavioral problems, panhypopituitarism, precocious puberty, imperforate anus, polydactyly.
Two prominent midline lesions identified on MRI: hypothalamic hamartoma and a Rathke cleft cyst.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial refractory seizures improved to being seizure-free after successful surgical interventions.
